answerText: special relativity[10] Many equations in special relativity have this factor, which is equal to 1 over the square root of the quantity one minus the velocity squared over the speed of light squared.

question: Question: One important test of this theory involved measuring the half-life of the muon, and calculations in this theory are often done in Minkowski space. [10] Name this theory developed by Albert Einstein which explains effects like time dilation and length contraction. It was the precursor to another theory that described gravity in terms of curved spacetime.
